website_summaries.verdict: This product helps you put the gas exactly where you want it without leaking or spilling on the ground.
pros: Fair price for a 5-gallon gas can
Makes refueling a boat easy on the water without leaking gas into the water
Meets EPA and CARB standards for safety
The funnel can handle smaller gas tanks, down to 0.875 inches
cons: If the gasket falls off or is missing, the can will leak

customer_reviews.title: A recall should be issued.
customer_reviews.text: What I received is a "sho-spill" gas can. The cap threads are misaligned and the cap does not seal. See attached photo. I did not cross-thread it. Gas immediately spills onto the floor. Unbelievable! And Amazon will not take it back. I will contact the company directly as a recall should be issued.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this No-Spill 5 Gallon Gas Can.
customer_reviews.text: The No-Spill 1450 5-Gallon Gas Can arrived defective. The fill cap do not seal properly and allowed fluid to leak. We noticed that the fill cap was not perfectly round and had more of a oblong shape thus causing the rubber gasket on the cap to seal properly. Don't waste your money on the No-Spill 1450 Gas Can.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Product Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 5-gallon "no-spill" gas can to hold my 2-stroke small engine gas/oil mix. Here's what I did, and what the result was: -Poured Stihl Ultra-2 oil into the can -Filled the can with 2 gallons of ethanol-free gas -Shook the gas can gently to properly mix the fuel Result: Gas leaked out from underneath where the gas cap screws on. Moreover, the stench of gas in my garage is pretty bad, as the gas can obviously not sealed. Be advised that even my car ride on the way home from the gas station was a fume-filling experience. If you want a "no-spill" gas can, don't buy this one. Good evening.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as it was before
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this specific gas can. We loved the other. Enough that my hubby said, I want another of that kind, The less expensive ones wouldn't do. So, I ordered it again. It's been TERRIBLE since. The cap doesn't seem to fit the bottle correctly. iI's next to impossible to get it on or off. The grooves you twist it on, don't seem to be the same as the ones inside the cap. Today, he tells me that it is now leaking some. We are very disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: carols

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over my hands.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, like all of the others. It leaks onto my hand and car when fueling. Yes the gasket and cap were tight. I tell you, the epa really screwed up something that had worked fine for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Tufnel

customer_reviews.title: Gas can leaked all over my car! The threads ...
customer_reviews.text: Gas can leaked all over my car! The threads on the cap were defective so it did not seal. Could not and would not seal properly. Of course I didn't know this until I took it to the gas station and filled it up with five gallons of gas and put it in the back of mu SUV to take come. I guess if the property is made properly it will be "no spill" but this particular can was "much spill." Quality control is obviously an issue, because they should be checking the thread on the caps to make sure they close properly. I bought a 2.5 gallon version of this same can and had no problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Leak Proof.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's leak proof, has a filter built in to the inlet as well, which is nice. It's horrible actually pour from, though. You have to hold the button and tilt it up and you can only get the flow going so fast, so I hope you like holding 50lb in the air for 15 minutes while it gently urinates into your gas tank, or you squat over a push mower, awkwardly aiming the little yellow snout over the wrong size of funnel, all the while your lower-back swears it's vengeance. Seems well made though, and the cap is secure. It's "Easy to use," but inconvenient. Needs a couple more handles somewhere, or a hose, or something.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: i'm stuck with a leaky can or wasted money. I'll try to claim warranty to see ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine is leaky. I got it as an emergency travel can, i drove 2 miles from a gas station and found that the can was covered with gas. I thought, maybe i didn't seal it properly, re-tighted it again and the same story. Then i tilted the can and it started leaking from it. Now that i found that this gas can is not returnable by amazon policy (which the products page says nothing about), i'm stuck with a leaky can or wasted money. I'll try to claim warranty to see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: hitch

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for gas pumps at cosco.
customer_reviews.text: They are now using a filter to filter the gas going into the can. That has creator problem. A gas pump at cosco while pumping gas into the can. The filter stops it from going into the can. Gas starts overflowing the top of the gas can. It's still Is is a good gas can but I will have to figure out how to cut out the filter to be able to use it again. That would allow the gas flowing into the gas can. The gas pump column is to much for the filter to accept. I recommend making them without the filter like my older one.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Yaros

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Purchased These Gas Cans Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I have had so many different gas cans over the years and with the horrible gas spouts that have been coming out recently, I decided to research what others have found to be a good solution. Here it is, these are amazing! Purchased two 1.25 gallon cans (one for 2-stroke/mix), and a 5 gallon can. I use my old cans for storage now, and transfer gas from those to these when these run low. The auto shutoff works nice, but you do need to still keep an eye on the level and probably shut it off manually rather than completely relying on the auto shutoff, but still works nice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Truly the BEST gas can I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor had the smaller version of this No-Spill and we had used it to keep their lawn cut when they were on vacation. Call me what you want but I guess I am a simple man that enjoys those easy to use products in life. This is one of those products that whomever created it, needs to be honored with a great creation. The button control on the back is great in that you can depress it as you see fit to control the out flow of the gas. Again, one of the best products I have bought in 2020 thus far, well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This gas can works great if your like me and are paranoid and like to prepare for all possible scenarios! I always like having a plan B and this allows me to always keep about a tanks worth of gas stored in my trunk at all times in case of an emergency. I love the no spill spout it locks on super tight and you can feel confident keeping your gas stored and if it falls over you dont have to worry about any mess. I always keep this filled, stabilized, and stored in my trunk in case I need it, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: X3R0

customer_reviews.title: Leak on handle! GAS everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last August for gas for my boat. Just used it for the first time this season, and it was split on the inside of the handle. Was filling it with gas & gas went everywhere, on me, the gas station and the car. So annoyed and disappointed! Would love to get a new container but past 30 day refund!! Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Becka E.

customer_reviews.title: No spills while using this container
customer_reviews.text: Like most gas containers produced these days, there is no vent on this item. I got one, installed it and it worked out fine, still no leaks and now the gas pours out faster. While installing the vent, I noticed that the walls of this container are very thin. Using the button does give you better control of delivering the gas along with the secondary handle toward the back but, it is very slow - hence the vent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Weir

customer_reviews.title: The Gas Can use to be Amazing Until they Changed it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of these a year and half ago and they plastic was very thick and strong it worked perfect. I just got a new one and it is made of cheap plastic it looks like it is going to break. Where the lid screws on is poorly designed and it is almost impossible to get it screwed on. I will no longer recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic T

customer_reviews.title: Great features, ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these cans. The first I bought a few years back (2012) and there wasn't a plastic filter cup in the opening. The two I just bought have this feature. It caused the pump nozzle to constantly stop as the fuel backed up, and it took forever to fill the 5 gallons. Hey, the pumps are filtered. Because of the cap mounted dispenser, I'm not taking the lid off when I dispense fuel, so no need for these problem causing filters (you can pry them out). The cap mounted dispensing mechanism has always worked wonderfully, whether I am adding fuel to my vehicle, lawn equip., or generator.

customer_reviews.title: Flow rate is awful
customer_reviews.text: This flows at the rate of about a gallon a minute (so five minutes for the entire can) as there is no air intake valve. It takes forever to empty, it is a ridiculous design and not worth the money. It started leaking on the second use. Don’t waste your money here unless you use gasoline a thimbleful at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Fan

customer_reviews.title: Button hard to press
customer_reviews.text: This is so hard to press and pour into the gas tank. Holding 5 gallons is hard enough and to have to consistently press in a button at the same time to release the gas makes no sense. It should have s feature, where 2 presses of the button will keep it pressed down. I guess people do no test their product before putting it on the market. I will not buy this product again. Too complicated
customer_reviews.author: Marvelous Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas Can EVER
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this gas can. I have now ordered a 2.5 and a 1.25. The part I like is it doesn’t leak and even when held with gas to the nozzle nothing comes out until the button is pushed. One word of caution. Always push the button to relieve the pressure before you use it. It will blow out with force and can splash back at you if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Gary VanLaere

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away From This One - Good Concept, Quality Fail
customer_reviews.text: I have given this product at least one star because it offered both a top and backside handle, which most cans do not. Other than that, it's garbage. After having this for approximately three months, and filling 4 times, the rubber gasket that helps prevent leakage broke. Amazon did not allow a return, so I contacted the company with the problem (which seems to be quite common), requesting a remedy. No response. I was able to find a gasket at an auto parts store that seems to be working for now. Don't bother with this gas can. The company claims to stand by it's product, but clearly does not. Amazon would do well to not offer this product any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amk

customer_reviews.title: First CARB compliant jug I've had that actually WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap, but the valve/spout arrangement is SOOO much better than anything else we had since the EPA ruined gas jugs. Flow rate and venting are excellent, ease of use even better. Will not work for gassing up cars, but for my mower, tractor, ATV, motorcycles, etc., that all fill from the top it is a Godsend. Honestly, you'd have to work at it to spill any gas while using this jug. Wish they would sell the valve/spout assembly separately so I could retrofit all my pre-EPA jugs. It's that good.
customer_reviews.author: Machinery's Handbook

customer_reviews.title: OVERFLOW when filling LEAKING GAS EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: This thing cannot be filled up without spilling and stopping the pump every time, wasting my money and ensuring maximum gas spillage and embarrassment in front of everyone while I take 4 times as long and look as stupid as possible while doing it. Am I really expected to fill a different gasoline container and then fill this container from that container or something? WTF?!? I seriously can't believe this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Upset
customer_reviews.text: I was very upset when this product came - I was informed that this would work with one of those tsp's or whatever those automatic fuel pumps where you stick that into the gas can and it automatically pumps the gas into the vehicle. My husband is disabled and his started to leak - I chatted with both the company that makes the pump and amazon and was told this would be perfect. He can not use it cause there is a hose of some type in the can that can't be taken out. Lots of money for nothing and there it sits!!
customer_reviews.author: Gizzy

customer_reviews.title: Best gas can around
customer_reviews.text: The new gas can rules I think made them more prone to leak compared to old one like Rubbermaid. Don't waste your money on Briggs and Stratton cans like I had, this leak and nozzle gets stuck in open position. And the others I can find in local store appear to be similar design. Then I came upon this can. Gave it a shot and was pleased. This is my third can, first 2 is still working, but switching out the BG cans as time goes by. The spout is ment for mower etc tanks. For car get the spout attachment, make it easier and safer to fill your car.
customer_reviews.author: 4evryoung

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously defective, not fit for use
customer_reviews.text: The can's non-removable flame-prevention device (inside the can) makes it incompatible with vapor-recovery gas pumps, meaning you can't fill it more than half full. Also the dispensing mechanism leaked gasoline all over my hands when I attempted to fill my mower. the mechanism itself leaked gasoline. This is without a doubt the worst gas can I've ever used. This isn't a knock on the newer "leak proof" Cans. I have others that work fine. This one is just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Joby Lafky

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use now.
customer_reviews.text: When full it’s heavy .... now thanks for double handles it’s dispenses has easy now I recommend buying the hose extension for $5. More just in case
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy Campeau

customer_reviews.title: Great Cans
customer_reviews.text: We use these for everything: gas, diesel, kerosene. The spout thing looks a bit gimmicky, I know, but it actually works very well, particularly with the 5-gallon can, which with a normal spout can pretty awkward to use. A real bonus: no need any longer to hunt down that ever-elusive funnel (Where do they GO!) when you want to pour a little gas in the mower or diesel in the tractor. Oh, and we've never had one leak or dribble or lose function in any way.
customer_reviews.author: RW Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Solid built and has some nice safety features but hard to dispense
customer_reviews.text: Rating it 3 overall because of the difficulty of dispensing. It has a air pressure release valve built in which you are supposed to use before dispensing. Turns out it wouldn't dispense at all unless the valve was constantly pressed. Turns out thats not easy with a 5 gallon full can in one hand, pressing the safety valve with the other and trying to aim. Even then the flow was really small. After some acrobatics, broken arms and 20 minutes of dispensing which nobody has time for, I was cursing this thing. The dispensing needs to be redesigned- what are you thinking!
customer_reviews.author: Mr D A Nakra

customer_reviews.title: Quality concerns for longevity
customer_reviews.text: Seals nicely with no leaks. However the plastic used is thinner the others I have bought. Temperature can "suck" the walls in when outside and causes them to breakdown faster than other products I've bought. Sidewalls and corners need to be thicker if your using these outside or in a commercial setting. I have purchased twenty different ones over the years and for whatever reasons these haven't held up we'll in the short time I've owned
customer_reviews.author: TMB-VEGAS

customer_reviews.title: The only gas can i would use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gas can: it is easy to open, nothing spills, it is easy to pick up thanks to the two handles on the sides, and easy to pour gas in all my garden equipment. I like it so much that I have three, which is very useful when you have a generator!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One handed release at last!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than what I can buy at the big box hardware stores. Button easy to push and no annoying latches or two handed safety annoyances. Flows well too.
customer_reviews.author: mrdibs

customer_reviews.title: Best Can
customer_reviews.text: Best gas can out there. I picked one of these up a few years back and systematically through all of my other cans out that had the click, snap, or slide type heads that need to be engaged. I haven't found one application for these poorly designed cans where they're not cumbersome, hard to pour, and waste time, and leak gas all over the place. These are the exception. Well made, easy to pour with a one button design. Optional extension is great for longer reach if the filler tube is further done, like on a front loader. We now have these for our diesel machines and the smaller version for all of our mixed gas needs as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: buy a metal can!
customer_reviews.text: The can splits at the molding on the inside of the handle area. Allowing gallons of gas to spill out. Gas can has been stored in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Much thinner than when purchased two years ago
customer_reviews.text: Loved my gas cans, with the extender hose. Purchased several more, and they are super thin. The old ones I could not see how full cans were getting when filling, and the new ones you can. Nice to have that, but when can emptied to 1/4 full, can collapsed on self. I did not have to remove the cap (not super easy with the teeth to keep it in place) with my old ones, and they held their shape just fine. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: fishinbug

customer_reviews.title: No-Spill 1450 5-Gallon Poly Gas Can (CARB Compliant) Sold by: Outdoor Power Direct
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the No-Spill 1450 5-Gallon Poly Gas Can; filled it with four gallons of gas and then turned it on its side, no spill. Went to fill my riding mower gas tank; I pressed the button on the gas can; gas started pouring into the mower gas tank, on the mower, on the ground and me, we tighten the sprout as tight as possible. This thing leaks like a sift.
customer_reviews.author: S Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Warranty says 3 years... Exactly 3 years + 13 days after I got it, it sprung TWO leaks while transporting a full 5 gallons home from the gas station in the front seat of my car. Both holes were next to the raised lettering, which must be a weak point Also, did not seem to pour any faster than any other can in my experience. Will not buy another
customer_reviews.author: Spemph

customer_reviews.title: Good Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to dispense, providing you don't need a longer hose. I do believe they make an extension and may have to look into it. Prior to this I hated the "new" "CARB Compliant" gas caps. They were just another example of over legislation that ended causing more problems then it fixed. I spilled a lot more gas using those then the old type. While this "no spill" can is more expensive it is worth the price. I will only purchase this type of can in the future. Recognizing of course they last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, seals up tight
customer_reviews.text: It is airtight for sure, if the temperature changes it causes this can to expand or contract and you can hear a whoosh when you activate the valve. Valve is easier to operate than a lot of other gas cans that are available these days, so that is very nice. If you are concerned about it being too heavy when full, don't fill it all the way - the can itself is not heavy. Will not fill a normal automobile without adding a funnel or attachment, as the nozzle is not long enough to open the flap in most cars' fuel inlet.
customer_reviews.author: PenneSue

customer_reviews.title: nozzle is too short, button is too hard to press and hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep some extra gas for car but the nozzle is too short and you need an funnel in order to empty the last bit of the gas because there is no way to empty the entire tank. also I find it very hard to keep the release button pressed down while holding the 5 gallon tank in the air with just two hand. this is not a convenient gas can to be use for that purpose only. Won't recommend if you only use it to fill your car tank. I would return it if I could and get a simple one from home depot or Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lin

customer_reviews.title: Truly No Spill
customer_reviews.text: Lay the lip of this can on the lip of whatever you are filling, and you can hold it with a finger or two. No spills, no mess, no trying to hold the weight of the can while you balance it and direct the spout. Great for jet skis and riding lawn mowers.
customer_reviews.author: rarelyreview

customer_reviews.title: Great For Generator and lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: The jug itself does what it’s supposed to do which is hold gasoline. What we are really reviewing is the nozzle...I bought this for refueling my generator and lawnmower. And it works great for that!..basically anything where you can get right over the top of the tank to refuel. Does not work so good for refueling vehicles however the short nozzle makes it very hard to get the right angle!..But I still give it five stars because it works great for what I am refueling with it!
customer_reviews.author: Brother Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: It dribbled all over my foot the 1st time I used it. I had to hold the thumb button down the whole time I was filling. I thought it was 1 push for on and 1 push for off. If you cover the whole button with your thumb it cuts off the air. It didn't stop the flow when the gas covered the tip either. Not much better than the cheapies. I was expecting much better.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell C.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the pouring technology....but quality of the can itself is poor.
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in buying the no spill gas cans for use around the house. The pour technology is pretty good...but there is a problem with the 5-gallon plastic can sort of crushing itself... in that the walls of the can are sunken way inward to the point where in fall weather, I can't get a full 5 gallons in the thing. Won't be buying these on the Amazon sites anymore because I want to see the can before it delivers...all shrunken inward.
customer_reviews.author: JdhBrock

customer_reviews.title: Split open
customer_reviews.text: I have used this three times since purchasing it late last August. It has sat in place and the top of the handle has split open, allowing fumes to escape. Was great up til this point but garbage as it sits.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best fuel container
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. After using this, you'll toss out all of your other gas cans. Lid is secure, and doesn't leak when dispensing. When you let go of the button, the fuel stops. These are the only kind I use now.
customer_reviews.author: Dean G.

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some have issues with it. I have a John Deere lawn tractor and it works exactly as advertised. Plus, it is easier to lift and hold in position than my old style plastic gas can which ALWAYS dripped some gas on the filler area and my hands. Seems overpriced but I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CigarMan

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: So I emptied the old gas can into this one. Very nice. No leaks! I filled my power washer which was great BUT didn't realize it doesn't shut off like I thought it would. Thought I saw in a video that it did, it must have been for another brand. That's the only negative thing about it so far and that I got gas all over my new shoes and the powerwasher and the garage floor. Now I know and you know. I looked at the asked questions but there were some really stupid-funny questions I couldn't help but laugh at them but couldn't find any serious ones. They need to clean them up lol
customer_reviews.author: Bballmomof2boys

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas Can I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Love this can (is that possible) so much I bought 3. I use them to fill my boat with marine gas that is cheaper at gas stations than marinas. These can are easy to fill, don't leak, don't rust, nice handle to carry to boat, easy to fill my boat tank because of the air channel inside the spout that allows quick dispensing of gas. I have nothing negative to say about these cans. I LOVE THEM!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn  McSwain

customer_reviews.title: The new Spark arrest design makes gas spill when filling at a pump
customer_reviews.text: I have the old version of the can and the old spark arrest design is hard to fill, but doesnt cause gas to spurt out. This version is impractical. It will cause many owners to remove the spark arrester, which make the can LESS SAFE.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent spout system
customer_reviews.text: Best fuel dispenser ever... Well, not as good as the old-school "just a plastic cap over the end of the spout" kind, but in this age of "safety first" and "controlled emissions" (you know, when that old plastic cap's strap broke and disappeared), this is the best spout system ever. I like the auto-stop float feature... it'll be handy for the teenage kid who mows the grass... no more overflows onto the mower deck, sidewalk, driveway, or grass.. Only complaint (and this is with all gas cans that have the "ratchet" lock system--hard to get the cap off...
customer_reviews.author: Tim Eichman

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy container.
customer_reviews.text: It is close to 100% no spill. Easy to operate. I would definitely order the extension tube with it to fill small equipment easier. All N all good gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Stan, Cooking at Home

customer_reviews.title: Spout not long enough to fully open the filler door of our GMC truck.
customer_reviews.text: The spout and it's safety/on/trigger design may be okay for a lawnmower, but it is not long enough to enter the gas tank filler of our truck. So, we had to improvise with an additional funnel and the safety feature wouldn't work. We had to use our hands to depress the spout and ended up getting gas on the car, our hands and the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Vernazzait

customer_reviews.title: Causes more spills than old snake neck style
customer_reviews.text: I have used this 5 times and so far each time I have spilled or overflowed a push mower, pressure washer. The mechanism does not auto shutoff and is so large that it takes up most of the fill port so you cant see the gas in the tank so it just spills over. Terrible design that causes more spills and waste of gas than old style tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Clark

customer_reviews.title: Tricky at first, but works great!
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I had some initial leaking as the cap didn't want to sit on straight and would apperantly cross-thread . Once I figured out that you really need to tighten it by pushing down on both sides of the cap while tightening it, it tightened easier and I have had no troubles and the cap fits flush as it should. The functionality of the no-spill spout is great! I have no problems with just sticking the nozzle in to my mower or generator and pushing the button with confidence that it will shut off when the level in the tank reaches the nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nettles

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Of all the gas cans, of newer no vent, I have ever used these No-Spill brand are absolutely the best. Easy to fill. Lid screws on tight, no leaks. The valve on top for pouring is easy to use. The valve makes it really hard for you to spill the gas. Not that you can't spill gas but basically you put nozzle into what you're filling, tip can and press button. I highly recommend these cans. 👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: E. A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the average gas can!
customer_reviews.text: Completely worth the price if you have some kind of hand or arm injury. These gas cans can easily be used one handed as long as you can pick up a full jug. Bought one of these for our generator for hurricane Florence and it made it so easy to fill it. There's only 2 of us and we both have some kind of arm injury that makes it difficult to use a normal jug without making a mess or using a massive funnel. With this gas can I didn't spill a drop and could use it by myself and I'm maybe 120lbs soaking wet.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a great gas can. I LOVE the easy pour spout. I took one star off because the plastic seems a little thin, definitely thinner than the 2.5-gallon cans I have gotten in the same brand and style. Which is odd because I would think the more capacity cans would be thicker/stronger. A little pricey but I think the ease of use is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: bajasir

customer_reviews.title: This design was the answer to me stopping fuel spills.
customer_reviews.text: I do all my own landscaping. This fuel tank with its fill cap that is placed on the top of the can, and is perfectly level works great. The push button dispenser makes fueling my lawn tractor very neat, with no spillage. This design was the answer to me stopping fuel spills. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Cantelmo

customer_reviews.title: Leaks so badly it's unusable!
customer_reviews.text: This can leaks terribly! The pushbutton works fine, but the cap will not seal properly to the can. Just tilting the can up causes massive leaking. The gasket is in place and my husband has tightened the cap as much as possible, but is unable to stop the leaking. The can is completely unusable and I will have to transfer the gas to another container just to dispense it. We have emailed the company and will update this comment if/when they respond.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Stupid Government Regulations
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a new, much bigger gas can after moving out of the city. Went to the local store and saw that cans now all have to have some safety feature. The one I got from the store caused me to spill more on the ground then get into the tank. The No-Spill however is Awesome. The safety pour feature of this one allows me to control very easy what I am pouring and actually be in control of the amount I am filling. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Droof

customer_reviews.title: Prone to gasoline spills when filling.
customer_reviews.text: The inlet is small and flow is constrained by a filter. The result is that the tank cannot be filled at full speed from the pump. My first filling took several minutes and three or four unintended splashes of gasoline onto the tarmac. Environmentally unsatisfactory. I plan to remove the inlet filter, even though the sticker says not to since it is some sort of a safety device.. It takes three hands to fuel a generator; two to hold the tank waist high and a third to depress the value. The technology works fine for smaller sizes which can be held by one hand but does not work for the 5-gallon size.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lingane

customer_reviews.title: No-Spill? I wish.
customer_reviews.text: As a gas can, it functions admirably. As it advertises about No-Spill, it does not. I bought the 5-Gallon can expecting it to work as advertised, since most reviews said it does... and I've found that even under ideal circumstances, the spout will not stop on its own. It's really unfortunate because I could have gotten a 5-gallon can for much cheaper, and I can't return this one anymore due to its being used to contain gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lift.
customer_reviews.text: You know these are nice cans and they function well with a minor exception. When you put the spout in the opening and press the plunger, if you don't (or cannot) put it in far enough you have to watch it carefully to make sure it doesn't overflow. Aside from that they work well and are worth the price. Easy to lift and pour. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: DS1947

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous spout!
customer_reviews.text: The beauty of this gas can is in the spout. It's so much better than the kind you have to pull back to release the gas. With this spout, you position the spout in the tank filler opening, then push the button to release the gas into the tank. The gas flow stops immediately when you release the button. Holding the button depressed is a lot easier than holding the other kind of spout against the spring pressure. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Best fuel can on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fuel can I’ve ever had,I’ve purchased a second one for my diesel fuel,obviously I’ve marked them accordingly so as to have cross fuel contamination. This is the best fuel can in the market and as long as you follow the instructions on the can you’ll never have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Burma

customer_reviews.title: Good gas can
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have any of the leakage issues that others have complained about, but I made sure the O-ring that came with it was installed properly. When I got it the O-ring was only partially on but was easy to get it installed all the way. I have to say that I hate the push button fuel flow control and much prefer the nozzle compression to start the flow, but I know that's due to regulations and don't penalize the manufacturer for it.
customer_reviews.author: cdeuce

customer_reviews.title: Cap leaks
customer_reviews.text: This can is the best I've come across by far. Love the double handles, and the push button. The button is easy to depress, the back handle makes it easy to hold in position. Love the little stem that holds the weight of the can on the lip of the tank opening. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I had to tighten the spout with channel locks to get it tight enough to stop leaking, and I wish it had a vent. I know it's not a design problem, it's big brother the government.
customer_reviews.author: Garebear

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in a gas can
customer_reviews.text: Simply brilliant, takes the struggle out of pouring gas. Just set the can on a shelf and you're ready to go, no lifting required. The vented spout allows a robust flow, and it can't get any easier than pushing a button. Just twist the spout to the top when you're done so it doesn't drip. Also great for pouring into the gas tank of my portable generator without spilling a drop.
customer_reviews.author: Rod NH

customer_reviews.title: Overall the build is nice
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several before I bought this one. It was one of the better values in gas cans you can get, but not the cheapest. It functions well, and the fill/pour works well. Safety features are part of what you have to have now, so just deal with them. They don’t get in the way of use. Overall, the build is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Madere

customer_reviews.title: Best Can ever
customer_reviews.text: I have hard time pouring gas in my John Deere X738 tractor with the JD metal cab. I have purchased dozens of cans advertising as "No Spill" but this is the first one to prove it. It works just as advertised. I also got the spout extension and that made it much easier. Its worth every penny in my opinion. Nothing worse then spilling gas and I poured it 4 gals and never spilled a drop and it shut off advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Raffaelli

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent to pour. Must be aligned perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it pours well, if held perfectly straight. The spout is short however, so you often have to hold it sideways to reach the tank. When this happens, It hardly pours. The venting doesn't work. Frustrating. That said, I have yet to experience a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Rule

customer_reviews.title: worth the money---pay a little more and stop hating your life
customer_reviews.text: I'll be the first to say that I really hate the new gas cans that are "no spill," but with that being said, I actually don't mind this can. It's pour spot is quite easy to use with one hand and I've had no trouble filling up our snow blower, motorcycles, fourwheelers, or any other gas powered device. In the video it showed a lady pouring so accurately she could fill up shot glasses---while I'm not sure that's the case, I would recommend this product to anyone and I no longer hate filling things up with gas.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Bosshardt

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Yep, it leaks.
customer_reviews.text: So far, not good. Just bought this. Received it on Monday and filled it today. Leaks like you know what coming out of a boot. Messaged the company. Got gasoline on my tennis shoe as well. Update: Got into contact with the company. Good customer service. I received a tutorial on how to correctly screw on the nozzle. I know I know. Anyway, it leaks much less and is acceptable. At least it's not pouring out. I've upgrade to 3 stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Locke

customer_reviews.title: 5 Cans 6 Years. Still no leaks or spills!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these, all several years old, they’ve all been beat up badly and banged up from my kids tossing them around every weekend and they all still hold fuel with no leaks and no spills. I bought them one at a time as I needed more capacity over the past 6 years and none of them have given me any problems. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: MADE FROM POOR/WEAK MATERAL
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with leaking or pouring with product. However, the bottom of the container is no longer flat and looks like the bottom of a boat. I am concerned that due to the narrow point of contact the bottom will wear through and gasoline will be all over my garage floor. Too late for me to return so I'm looking for a safer alternative, most likely metal.
customer_reviews.author: MWD

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gas can I've used. I have two and will order another two. It doesn't leak even when filling and so far it's held its shape. The only complaint I have is that it's a bit difficult to get the cap unscrewed because the teeth are so large.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: When I first started filling it up at full speed the gas jumped out but after I adjusted the gas handle at the pump it was smooth sailing. I haven't noticed any gas smells and it was easy and quick to fill the lawn mower with the nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy to dispense, no leaking and works just as expected. I would advise pressing the dispense cap away for equipment or individuals prior to dispensing to allow vapor to escape first. Otherwise, very nice gas dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: PURDUE98

customer_reviews.title: No spill is right!
customer_reviews.text: People who use other gas cans are fools... FOOLS! This won't spill a drop.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A few minor issues
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but I have 2 issues with it. First, the spout is difficult to get off. The little tab you have to press to unscrew the top requires quite a bit of pressure. You have to be careful putting the top back on too, or it will be crooked. The second issue is that the cap for the spout. It is a littel tricky to get off. Also, it is the same color at the spout, making it too easy to forget to remove the spout. Then you have a spout full of gas that's going to leak all over your hands when you remove the cap.
customer_reviews.author: RobertS

customer_reviews.title: Better than most, still not perfect
customer_reviews.text: First of all, i hate whatever politician legislated gas cans...they leak more now that all these stupid spouts are required. Just give me a regular spout without all the gimmicky shutoff features that break after one season!!! Argh!!! Anyway... This can has decent handles for pouring from different positions, which is a great feature overlooked by many. The spout on this one works ok for now, but i assume it will break within two years like every other can i've had. For the price, this can is better than all other ones i've had-- which sounds good, but the bar has been pretty low.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: Defective after only one year sitting in a shady storage!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for one year I purchased it last July. It has been stored in a shady area with no huge temperature changes. I live in Hawaii. And it split right there on the handle. Save your money and buy a different product. This is rediculous for the money. I have never had a can fail like that. Very dissapointing your selling defective products.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Welch

customer_reviews.title: Splitting at seam
customer_reviews.text: Had less than two weeks and noticed that the seam is splitting. I also noticed that it does not vent the gas fumes at all and causes the can to bulge a lot and collapse due to temper changes. Will toss can as I am afraid the seam will split and cause gas to spill in my shed and cause a hazard.
customer_reviews.author: A Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The HYPE is Real! Best Gas Can on the Market!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful when I ordered this gas can. I’m glad to say that the hype is real. Easy pour! No Leaks! One tip I learned out the hard way. Make sure you tighten the spout to the can firmly. I had some small drips down the front of the can and I found that it was user error. I love it so much I’m ordering the 2.5 Gallon!
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Steve

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have 5-6 gas cans at home in the shed, but this one is BY FAR THE BEST I have ever used. watch the video on how it dispenses the gas, it is amazing. I will get a second one and get rid of my older cans that I've used for 20 years, and spilled gas for 20 years - lol
customer_reviews.author: S. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Leaked all over my shoe the first time.
customer_reviews.text: From the first time I used it, it leaked all over my shoe when filling the gas tank on my motorcycle. Requires two hands to dispense, and especially awkward with a full 5 gallons. So what am I supposed to do now? Can't return it after it's had gasoline in it. I'd at least hope for another free spout sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Devyn G. Damore

customer_reviews.title: If works as advertised these will be awesome
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Love the design/functionality. If it doesn't leak when I start pouring fuel these will be the best gas cans I have used. Pushing a button to dispense is some much easier and more controllable than other types.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money! Doesn’t even deserve 1 star. Leaks when you try to use it. Wish I could return it, but I just used it this week.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T GO WRONG HERE!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This gas container sports the perfect spout. one that breathes as it dispenses fuel at an amazingly controllable volume. Let go of the yellow button, flow stops immediately. No glug, glug for air. I have also purchased their1 & 2 1/2 gallon cans for ALL MY various blowers, mowers, etc. and that's where the spout on these cans really "COMES IN HANDY"!! No fuss, no muss. After hurricane Sandy and being without power for a week, I still used my suction/gravity pump to fill the generator but, after fighting those ridiculous, designed in HADES spouts that come with cans from the "Big Box Stores" and finding these "NO SPILL" cans on Amazon.....PROBLEM SOLVED!!
customer_reviews.author: Wrench

customer_reviews.title: Perfect OS moment for the boat.
customer_reviews.text: Avoided a storm on the water and almost ran out of gas. I keep this awesome no spill gas can between the outboard motor and transom well. Tie it down of coarse. Perfect for the boat.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gas can - so easy to fill the tank on my riding mower!!
customer_reviews.text: The best accessory I've purchased for my riding mower!!! I love this gas can (now, there's a sentence you don't hear every day)! I've struggled with gas cans ever since they put the air-pollution measures in place - most of them flow so slowly that your arms nearly fall off holding the can there while the tank fills up. This one, however, you perch it on top of the opening and hold on to it by the nice handle at the back, press the button and hold it down, and it fills very quickly and stops on its own when the tank is full. I can't say enough good things about this gas can!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can! I've had mine for 6-months...have not had any issues with the cap leaking... easy pressure relief & durable body!
customer_reviews.text: Great Gas Can! I've had mine for 6-months now and would really hate going back to a traditional pull-out spout and all that mess. The button pour spout works perfect and the dual handle design makes handling and dispensing fuel so much easier. I also have not had any issues with the cap leaking, but I should note note the you will have to tighten it down past the little black stopper teeth for a good seal. Refilled many times and it really works great, no mess, easy pressure relief and a durable plastic body. What more could you ask for in a gas can?
customer_reviews.author: NJturtlePower

customer_reviews.title: Easy-to-use pour mechanism
customer_reviews.text: The gas can arrived within a couple of days of ordering it. I filled it, put it in the trunk and drove around doing errands for at least an hour. No smells in the car and no leakage. Filled the gas tank on my snow blower and the button dispenser worked fine - no leaks, no spills, and the flow was easy to control. Because the can is heavy when full, it may be difficult to push the button while holding the can steady in some applications, but I was able to rest the can on the snow blower and fill the tank without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: I have so many gas cans! Hobby farm, tractors, dirt bikes, jet skis, mopeds, lawn equipment etc. I started to buy these no spill cans a couple of years ago and love the ease of use of the push button and automatic flow stop when a tank is full. I have every size and multiples of them. They are worth the extra money. Highly recommend and will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Husband Approved!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this is the best gas container he/we have ever purchased! He is a construction manager and takes this on site during the winter months so that he can refill the construction trailers generator. He says it fills the generator tank quickly so he's not standing out there waiting for a slow chug and that it emits virtually no fumes in his truck and sometimes forgets that its in the back. Next time we lose or need another new can we will be coming back to buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ryanne Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: The Best There Is
customer_reviews.text: I've had this gas can for several years and every time I refill my lawn mower or snow blower I thank my lucky stars for finding it here on Amazon. No more spilled gasoline for overfills, and no more worries about it tipping or leaking in the car. This product is amazing. It will not start dispensing the gas until you press the green button on the backside of the nozzle. No more premature spills while you aim a flexible hose, and no more multiple caps. Get this! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: meworkingstiff

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gas cans for most uses. The only thing I don't like about them is the flow rate. It can take a while if you're trying to empty out an entire 5 gallon jug. However, I will still use them because I don't need to worry about the gas going bad since there's no airflow. If the can is empty, you want to be careful about storing it in a hot location though because it will expand a lot. It sure is nice when you want to stop the flow, it completely stops. I can fill up anything and not worry about overflowing.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gas can.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice spill-proof, EPA gas can. Not as nice as an old, now prohibited simple can, but works well. And the anti-spill features don't get in the way too much. Good design to work around the silly rules. Note, unlike the 2-1/2 gallon version, this does not have a clear section that lets you see the gas level inside the tank. Took off a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, Apparently; Eventually Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Weirdly, squirrels *ate off most of the nozzle* of my can a couple of years ago. It still basically works OK, and I'm not sure that this is necessarily the manufacturer's fault, but that's the only shortcoming. 2018 Update: I just smelled gas outside today, the first warm day of spring. I saw that this gas can had sprung a leak, shooting a thin stream of gasoline two feet, where it was soaking a hay bale, alarmingly. I flipped the can on its side, and that solved the problem for now. Anyway, if you keep this outside for ~5 years, apparently it'll eventually crack open and leak.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Jaquith

customer_reviews.title: because I really do love this gas can and now own three after I ...
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm giving this a 4 star review is due to price. Maybe I'm picky, because I really do love this gas can and now own three after I have used the first one for two years. It is really easy to use and has proven itself to be helpful with just one person filling up gas. I love that you don't have to worry about spilling it by simply releasing the button or when the fuel gets to the certain height to equalize the pressure and stop the flow.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

product_meta.title: No-Spill 1450 5-Gallon Poly Gas Can (CARB Compliant)
product_meta.description: Style:Gas CanMost spills occur tipping a normal can to get the spout into the tank opening before the liquid comes out, or removing the spout from the target vessel before overflowing. The No-Spill spout is fully user controlled so you tip the can vertical, insert the spout into the vessel opening, then press the button to begin and control pouring. To stop pouring simply release the button. Practically eliminates spills and overflows. The only Spill-Proof spout with thumb button control that does not push down on your tank's filler neck to pour. More control, fewer tip-overs of your small equipment. The fastest pouring Spill-Proof nozzle available. At up to 3 gal/min, compare to other brands at 1.5 to 2.0 gal/min. Meets California Air Resources Board requirements for sale or use in California. Autostop removable nozzle, single opening for filling & pouring, treated can body for low permeation. Rear handle for pouring makes it the most user friendly CARB compliant 5 gallon can available. 6-inch Flex Spout Extension (sold separately) allows filling of on-road vehicles, boats and many other hard to reach tank openings. No-Spill Gasoline cans are tested and certified to ASTM F-85299 Standard Specification for Portable Gasoline Containers for Consumer Use and our Diesel & Kerosene cans are tested and certified to ASTM F-97602 Standard Specification for Portable Kerosene and Diesel Containers for Consumer Use. 5 Gallon CARB cans feature rear handle for well balanced pouring. Puts the can into the perfect position for pressing the thumb button.
feature_bullets: Thumb button control for precise pouring
7/8-inch funnel spout fills even the smallest equipment
Attached dust cover keeps your spout clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,242 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
